code:
export const blogPosts = [{
  id: 1,
  title: "Creating Authentic Public Safety Content",
  excerpt: "Learn how to capture compelling moments that resonate with your audience while maintaining operational integrity.",
  content: `
        Creating authentic content in the public safety space requires a delicate balance between capturing compelling moments and maintaining operational integrity. This comprehensive guide will help you navigate these challenges effectively.
  
        Understanding Your Audience
        Public safety content needs to resonate with both professionals in the field and the general public. Your content should educate while maintaining the respect and dignity of those involved in emergency services.
  
        Key Considerations:
        - Operational security and privacy
        - Department policies and procedures
        - Timing and sensitivity of content
        - Educational value and authenticity
  
        Best Practices for Content Creation:
        1. Always prioritize operational safety
        2. Obtain necessary permissions
        3. Focus on educational aspects
        4. Showcase real-world applications
        5. Maintain professional standards
  
        Remember, the goal is to create content that not only engages but also serves the public safety community while maintaining the highest professional standards.
      `,
  date: "March 15, 2024",
  readTime: "5 min read",
  category: "Content Creation",
  author: "John Smith",
  authorRole: "Fire Captain & Content Creator"
}
// Add more blog posts with full content...
];

sourcesContent:
export const blogPosts = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: "Creating Authentic Public Safety Content",
    excerpt:
      "Learn how to capture compelling moments that resonate with your audience while maintaining operational integrity.",
    content: `
        Creating authentic content in the public safety space requires a delicate balance between capturing compelling moments and maintaining operational integrity. This comprehensive guide will help you navigate these challenges effectively.
  
        Understanding Your Audience
        Public safety content needs to resonate with both professionals in the field and the general public. Your content should educate while maintaining the respect and dignity of those involved in emergency services.
  
        Key Considerations:
        - Operational security and privacy
        - Department policies and procedures
        - Timing and sensitivity of content
        - Educational value and authenticity
  
        Best Practices for Content Creation:
        1. Always prioritize operational safety
        2. Obtain necessary permissions
        3. Focus on educational aspects
        4. Showcase real-world applications
        5. Maintain professional standards
  
        Remember, the goal is to create content that not only engages but also serves the public safety community while maintaining the highest professional standards.
      `,
    date: "March 15, 2024",
    readTime: "5 min read",
    category: "Content Creation",
    author: "John Smith",
    authorRole: "Fire Captain & Content Creator",
  },
  // Add more blog posts with full content...
];
